headline: Chicken Pot Pie
description: A delicious, homemade chicken pot pie made from scratch with carrots, peas, and celery. This comfort food classic will be a hit with your family.

video.description: See how to make a delicious one-pot meal.
video.name: Chicken Pot Pie IX

name: Chicken Pot Pie
recipeIngredient: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cubed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C.)
Combine chicken, carrots, peas, and celery in a saucepan; add water to cover and bring to a boil. Boil for 15 minutes, then remove from the heat and drain.
While the chicken is cooking, melt butter in another saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft and translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in flour, salt, pepper, and celery seed
Slowly stir in chicken broth and milk. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until thick, 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.

Place chicken and vegetables in the bottom pie crust. Pour hot liquid mixture over top. Cover with top crust, seal the edges, and cut away any excess dough. Make several small slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape.
Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly, 30 to 35 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: Basic recipe is great but i hate peas so i add a cup or so of potatoes and a extra 1/4 cup broth so 2 cups broth instead of 1 3/4 to my pot pie.
We loved this recipe. We used rotisserie chicken. Wealso used canned carrots, peas and added corn. Sauce was real good. Will be making this alot more.

I used this as the basic recipe and tweaked it just a bit for my family. I wanted to double the recipe but didn't have 2 pie plates so I used a large casserole dish instead. I boiled my chicken and vegetables in chicken broth with my seasonings already added and drained them into a large measuring cup to use for my rue. After a put the chicken and vegetables in the dish, I sprinkled a small layer of parmesan cheese before I added the liquid. I also took someone's tip and used egg white on the top and bottom of crust. It was my first attempt at a pot pie, but my family insists I make it again! ♥️
Very good recipe! I eliminated the celery but kept the celery seed (I don't like celery) and it turned out amazing!
Easy to make and I added cheese to make it more cheesy gooey !! I cut the chicken small and pulled it apart a little, I egg washed the top shell to give it that final touch !
I doubled the recipe so everyone could have seconds. Everyone loved it

I have been using this recipe for years now, the only thing I do differently is, I cook the chicken in some butter and Evoo before adding it to the peas and carrots, I also add a bit of celery salt as well. So good!
I couldn’t stop eating it and the only thing I did differently was boiling it in chicken broth. Thinking about it now, I might go make another
Love this receipt. The pie was very good and tasty. I added to it 4 garlic cloves, oregano and sazon . Thank you

Only thing i done different wasd Cooked it all in a skillit with Garlic then added 3 Heaping Tablespoons of sour cream. It Taste so good my Tonge Slapped my Brains Out !! GREAT RECIPE, Yaw try the sour cream MMMM!!
I made this recipe as written with one exception. I used a rotisserie chicken. It was not dry. It was so good. I can’t wIt to make it again.
We thought this recipe was awesome. I made vegan chicken to add instead and a little bit of hot sauce at the end. Sooooo good. We are definitely going to make it again.

Boil chicken celery peas and carrots ?? No thank you. Boiling away flavor and nutrients. Dice and cook chicken in skillet with a 1T olive oil( added 1t italian seasoning a clove of garlic and 1/2 t sage) set aside. Meanwhile steam carrots, when almost done add peas. In same skillet cook onions,celery follow directions from there.

So, I added the celery seeds during the cooking of the chicken and vegetables. Then I cooked the onions and butter, added one tablespoon of flour and cook that through. I used cream of chicken soup and half a cup of evaporated milk and enough water to make it less thick.
Yore some left over sandwich buns Excellent recipe for tasty pie. I added a can of cream of celery soup to filling one dinner and substituted one can of cre Of mushroom the next. Both were hits.
Good recipe but I like it better using cream of chicken soup instead of chicken broth and flour. I still add in a little milk the soup is thick. Turned out Perfect 👍

I love this recipe!! Have made it multiple times. The few changes I make are adding in mushrooms and replacing regular milk with Almond milk. Delicious! I also make homemade crust using the below recipe included. 😉
No changes made crust from scratch.

I baked chicken thighs and removed the skin from the chicken. I also used a bag of mixed vegetables that I heated in the microwave. I used store bought pie crust. The rest of the recipe I followed. I checked out the comments and used the recommendation to use an egg white wash on the bottom of the crust and the top of it. That really worked well and baked the crusts evenly. So easy and looked great and tasted fabulous!!

I changed a couple steps to make it easier. I pre-baked the bottom crust for 7 minutes on 450* to ensure a crisp crust. I added approx 3 cups Frozen, Costco Veggies and onions to the veggie/chicken pot and kept the water in. I didn't have extra chicken broth, so I added a teaspoon of Better than Bouillon Beef Broth mix and about a cup of water, stirred till thick. Then, I added the chicken/veggie mix on the pre-baked bottom crust, and rolled out the top pie crust. I sprinkled a garlic seasoning on the crust. Baked as normal. NO ONE could tell the difference in texture or taste, and was much healthier. We all ate the leftovers for breakfast as it was SO good!

I‘ve made this numerous times throughout the last few years and have enjoyed the recipe without any substantial substitutes. I’ve recently started using bone in skin on chicken. I prepare that first by removing both. Placing them on tinfoil lined baking sheet with salt and roasting. The chicken skin can be a crispy treat for the chef or a nice bit of cracklin as garnish. The bones are also a tasty morsel for anyone Whos eagerly waiting. Ultimately your going to want to save the render chicken fat and substitute it for the butter in the rue. It literally tastes like Marie Calendar. Your welcome!
Left the cellery out added potatoes and corn. My husband lived it!

I’ve made this recipe so many times and it always turns out amazing! It’s good as is, even better if you add dried sage, thyme, and parsley, and even better if you use fresh herbs. I usually either cut my chicken into pieces and cook it a the pan or roast it in the oven. Sometimes I add potatoes. I cook it in a glass pie dish and I’ve never had a problem with the crust coming out soggy. Great recipe with lots of ways to make adjustments!

I think this is a wonderful recipe that can be modified depending on what you have available. I had leftover rotisserie chicken that I used and I cut it into small pieces. Are used chicken bouillon so I took one of those big cubes that you use with 2 cups of water and I put it in 1 and 3/4 c water, then, after it dissolved, I added the milk to it. While I was sautéing onions, and celery, I added the flour to the boullion and milk mixture since it was cooled down some. Whisked that well, then added that to my celery and onions that I was sautéing in the butter. I cheated and used a ready-made piecrust. One of the key things to not have a soggy crust, is to add your ingredients into the pie crust right before you are going to put it in the preheated oven. Delicious. Rotisserie chicken added good flavor and wasn’t soaked chicken from boiling.
Just made it. I didn't add celery salt added a tbsp of butter though. I just know it puts the little frozen pot pies to shame
Great recipe....totally tweaked it but kept within the realm....♥

This is a great recipe! The sauce is a perfect consistency. I added more carrots, more peas, mushrooms and corn which balanced the meat to veggie ratio. It also makes everything thicker and the slices stand on their own a bit more. Otherwise it can get mushy and its hard to get a good slice that hold up. Husband commented that its all about the crust! We use Pillsbury crust. We did ours in a ceramic pie pan which probably makes a difference on how firm it cooks. The aluminum pans probably would make the crust more brown and hard. We will experiment more with this recipe for sure!

This pot pie was delicious, but I did add a little fresh chopped garlic and a half teaspoon of poultry seasoning. I used a bag of frozen mixed veggies instead of peas and fresh carrots alone…we like the added corn and green beans along with peas and carrots. I also brushed the inner crust, before filling, with egg white and also brushed the top with the same. Mine only took @25 minutes to bake on 425.

I made this last night after reading the reviews. I sautéed the chicken (used Tony's seasoning) and vegetables and used one extra tbsp of flour. Otherwise I followed the recipe. Came out good. Husband says too many peas and demands I add potatoes next time.

Love this recipe! Instead of water to cook the chicken and vegetables I used the broth that I used later to make the gravey. I just strained the chicken and vegetables. This gave the mix more flavor. I also added a teaspoon of rubbed sage. It was a total hit!
I added thyme, smashed garlic cloves, bay leaves, and salt to the water, which was a great flavor addition! Wish I’d have added more chicken broth as it turned out a little dry.
Amazing - Gluten free version Used chicken bone broth Frozen mixed vegetables Costco precooked rotisserie chicken Topped with Bisquick gluten free biscuit mix

I did modify a bit.. Canned peas + carrots Precooked chicken, cubed small Sauteed celery with the onions (Since other ingredients were cooked already) Cream of chicken + 1c. Water (didn't have chicken stock on hand) Added canned potatoes, cubed Premade pie crust. Followed the first step with onions (+celery) butter, flour.. I combined everything in a big pan first, it was super thick and creamy, then poured into pie base, and topped with the second pie crust. Forked holes in top. I didn't consider the amount of salt in the ingredients so I did over salt (should not have added any additional) the leftovers will be good though.. This was so good, first time I ever made this on my own, and haven't had a pot pie since I was a kid. Your recipe gave me confidence that I could do it. Thanks! This to me is a true pot pie, I live in amish country and they consider the noodle dish to be a pot pie.. Definately will make more of your dishes!

I followed the recipe halfway, I made the following optional changes and it came out flavorful, delicious and the crust was perfect and not soggy. -I did not boil the chicken and I did 1.5. pounds; I grilled it with garlic powder and any chicken seasoning ( or you can stove top it) then I chopped it up into bite size pieces and set it aside until later. -I added butter to a skillet with minced garlic then added the sliced carrots and celery. I let that cook and at the end I added frozen green peas and a small can of corn- drained. Once this cooked I added in the chopped up grilled chicken and tossed it around then set on a low setting to keep warm. - I used half and half instead of milk- it came out creamy and perfect texture. Once this mixture was all put togethor at the right consistency I added the following seasonings: cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, Italian seasoning, paprika and a little nutmeg. I eyeballed these seasonings and did taste test. I highly suggest adding additional seasoning then what the recipe calls for. -I did a egg white wash on the bottom crust before I added the filling to avoid soggy crust. Then when I added the top crust I did a final egg wash again. - I let it sit for a minimum 15 min before cutting into it so it held it's form well and it didn't fall apart.

Awesome but like some others I made a few adjustments. Egg washed the crust. Prepared chicken separately frying it in olive oil with 2 tsp of poultry seasoning, 1/2 tsp garlic powder and 1 1/2 tsp of dried parsley.

I followed this recipe pretty close. I cooked chicken in skillet then sautéed the vegetables in the same skillet. From there I pretty much followed the recipe. It was a huge hit! I'll definitely be making this one again.
Delicious! My whole family loved it.

I agree with others that it was very bland and added a tablespoon of Knorr poultry seasoning, onion powder and parsley into the mix. I didn’t have celery, but added a total of 4 cups of veggies…peas, carrots, diced potato and green beans. It juuuust fit in my 9” deep dish pie plate. We loved it and would make again!

I definitely made changes. Boiling chicken does not give it flavor so I just grilled it with garlic seasoning and then cooked the onions, flour, milk, and broth in the same pan without cleaning it. Gave it great flavor. turned out great

I am not sure why boiling the chicken w/ the veggies is suggested, it loses all its flavor and nutrients. I also suggest using rotisserie chicken as a time saver and adds phenomenal flavor! I sautéed my onion and celery together, then after you create the “sauce” add the frozen peas, carrots, and rotisserie till heated through. Once your mixture is completed add to the pie crust. Then to prevent the pie crust edges from over cooking, line the edges with tin foil and then uncover for the last 10 minutes of cooking.
This is amazing! I did not have celery so I added a cup of diced potatoes instead. Made everything else exactly as written. Hubby approved!
I made this for my family and they loved it! No onions or celery. I didn’t have any. Used frozen peas and carrots. Added a layer of cooked white rice before pouring sauce on.
I have made this recipe as-is several times and my family loves it!! The only change is that I use rotisserie chicken and add a bit more salt.
This is one of my family's favorite recipes! The only change I make is that I use cut up rotisserie chicken.

I don't understand the complaints about this recipe. If you actually read the whole thing, it says in the beginning to add thyme, poultry seasoning, and mushrooms for more flavor which I did on my own anyway. Also, I deglazed the mushroom pan with white wine, added a bit of stock, and roasted the chicken first. Idk, a boiled chicken just doesn't sound flavorful to me although most of the other recipes also say to boil. I gave this a 4 because I feel they should have just added the thyme, poultry seasoning, and mushrooms from the get go to the recipe. But, maybe they just didn't want the recipe to seem like it had too many ingredients . Also, to me if I feel something seems lacking in a recipe, I just add it in. The world will not come to an end. Thank you for this great recipe. Salute!

Instructions result in flavorless meal. I added boiled potato and lots of spices (salt, black pepper, red pepper flakes, paprika, garlic, basil, rosemary, Mrs. Dash, etc.) and family approved. Good starter recipe to use for inspiration
didn't have chicken broth so used vegetable broth.... tasted great!
I fried my chicken and added seasonings . It was my first time making a pot pie it was delicious. I also used my own canned chicken broth which added more flavor. I also added diced potatoes.

I was mostly looing for a reminder on how to make the filling, using canned soup does not compare to making from scratch. I did keep adding stock to make a thinner filling because it seems to thicken a lot when baking. I used rotisserie chicken and a bag of mixed frozen vegetables plus a medium chopped boiled potato. Pre-packaged pie crust saved time and work, brush with egg white to keep crust from being soggy. Yes, I added more seasonings, It's a good idea to taste as you cook.

I follow this recipe but have a similar issue as others with it lacking flavor. Now, when I roast a chicken, I make a gravy from the drippings and add it to the broth for my pot pie. Seems to do the trick.

As an experienced cook who has never made a pot pie, I thought this was a good starter recipe. Instead of boiling the chicken, carrots, peas and celery I sautéed them in a little olive oil until the chicken was done, then stirred in the flour, salt, pepper, plus dried tarragon, thyme, and a small bit of sage. After that cooked for two to three minutes, I added the broth and milk and simmered until thickened. The gravy was very tasty. I also brushed the interior crust with egg whites and used an egg wash on top. Thanks for the great ideas!
I left out the celery and added corn.
Add some spices to your preference but this gets a good start. Chicken Thighs add moisture and garlic and red pepper flakes add some spiciness if you prefer that.
Very good recipe. My wife has a favorite crust recipe, so we used it. The pot pie was really good

Made this tonight, and it was a HUGE hit for the entire family. Added red potato and sliced up some baby bellas I had on hand. After 20 years of cooking for my husband, he said it's the best one I've ever done. A definite keeper - thanks for the recipe!

I absolutely love this recipe, my only change was adding potatoes. I have 6" pot pie pans so I make them individually. Usually I will make a triple batch so I can freeze some. I will make them then put in freezer go get them the next day and vacuum seal them then bake on 400 for about 65 minutes.

I made this for Christmas, as my husband requested a homemade chicken pot pie. This was a terrific base, but I did make a number of additions and changes, as did most reviewers. Firstly, I made the filling in advance and kept overnight in fridge to meld all the flavors. I used cream instead of milk. I used chicken broth to boil the chicken and veggies, then saved that broth to use as the recipe later directed. I did not have celery seeds, but thought the original recipe lacked in seasoning, so I added a dash of Worcestershire sauce, a teaspoon of tarragon, a teaspoon of poultry seasoning, sprinkled in some dried parsley, fresh ground pepper and Himalayan Pink Salt. I made a homemade pie crust, a recipe I got on YT, using AP Flour, Canola Oil, salt and boiling water -- that's it! The crust was excellent. My family loved this dish for Christmas, perfect holiday comfort food during the cold, winter months.

I used 2 cups of milk but could've gotten away with just using 1. I added 1 cup of celery, ditched the celery seeds, used 2 cans of cream of chicken soup in with the roux, doubled the homemade crust on the bottom and whala! Got the GOAT compliment from family on this one!

As a BASE recipe, this is fine. However, there are definitely not enough seasonings in this recipe, so double (or triple) to taste and add whatever savory seasonings you'd add to a chicken soup (sage, poultry seasoning, whatever you have that would go well with a cream sauce). I made this as is out of curiosity and it was SO bland. We changed a few things about this recipe and we loved it! 1. I increased the butter/flour to 1/2 cup each so I didn't have that annoying bit of butter left over. Since you're going to have more roux, increase the chicken stock to 2 cups and the milk to 1 cup. 2. I did not boil the filling (chicken and veggies) in water. Why boil it in water, drain away some of the nutrients, and then add in chicken stock? I boiled it in enough chicken stock to cover, adding the seasonings while it cooked, removed after it was cooked through, strained it into a large measuring cup, and then used that cooking liquid as the chicken stock for the gravy. I did have a little more stock than I needed, but the leftovers would make a great base for ramen or a smaller serving of soup. 3. I cooked the roux a little longer, until it smelled nice and nutty. 4. MIX THE CHICKEN, VEGGIES, AND GRAVY BEFORE YOU PUT IT IN THE PAN. Just pouring the gravy over the veggies is going to leave dry spots and if you try to mix it up, you risk tearing the pie crust dough. just toss the filling in with the gravy, mix it all up, and scoop it out into the crust. 5. If you don't feel like making an actual pie, you can always cook the filling a little longer (temp check your chicken), do everything up to the gravy, throw some biscuits in the oven and make inside out chicken pot pie :)

I really liked it. I did take the advice and added poultry seasoning to the chicken while it cooked (and salt and pepper). Also added these to the gravy. I had to bake about 10 more mins. Husband loved it!
I’m son loved it. The only thing I would do differently is mix th sauce and meat mixer together then add to pie crust.
Add seasoned salt and poultry seasoning. Sauté all veggies (add mushrooms) in butter and then add flour making roux with everything. Stir in cooked Chicken at the end.
Made exactly per recipe, and it is delicious comfort food.
Very good, but I added Thyme which made it taste like comfort food. Also cooked bottom pie crust for a bit before adding any ingredients to prevent becoming soggy
Yes, pretty good! I substituted Oat Crust for bottom crust, yellow peppers for celery, and mozzarella cheese for top crust.
I made this found it needed a little more spice

My family loves this recipe! Even the toddlers, which is saying something. I now batch make them and freeze them for a quick meal later. I do cook my chicken separately, so I can season it and it is more flavorful. I put chicken bouillon cubes in the water to boil the vegetables. And the last thing I changed was to use slightly less milk.

Wanted to try using a Cornish game hen. This worked perfectly. My hubby wants me to put this recipe in every room of the house. This is not a robustly flavored recipe, it’s very basic, and it was exactly what I was looking for. Thank you

AMAZING! The whole family loved it! No leftovers, lol 😆. I did make it in a round cake dish and added just a bit more ingredients, and husband is picky about veggies so used frozen peas and corn. Now making turkey pot pie with this recipe after Thanksgiving.

I loved this recipe. I didn't have fresh carrots, but I had a frozen bag of mixed veggies which worked just fine. It was a very delicious and nostalgic dinner. I couldn't give it 5 stars only because my kids and husband weren't raving about it.
family loves it
I used rotisserie chicken and Better Than Bouillon instead of broth. It was incredible! Also, just a top crust is necessary we thought.

I doubled the recipe to make two. It was fantastic! I did add fresh thyme and rosemary when I was boiling the chicken and veggies. I saved the broth when I drained the chicken and veggie mix and used it when making the roux sauce. I also used evaporated milk instead of regular milk. I added salt, pepper, paprika, garlic. This will be in a regular rotation in my kitchen!
Love it!! Amazing Flavor, I added salt pepper and all seasoning and garlic. Taste the sauce before you dump in. I make this at least 2 or 3 times a month....
Entirely too dry, & I even used more chicken broth than called for. So disappointing!
I did fry the chicken and potatoes with spices as I saw reviews of it being bland. I mixed all ingredients before putting them in the pie shell. Added more spice and it was great!

It was a good recipe. My guy is allergic to milk, so I substituted milk with Cream of Chicken soup. I also added potatoes and EXTRA seasoning. Everyone’s taste buds are different 😜 But is a great Starting point! It’s cooling as I type! Will give update
Rich and creamy. Rustic chop on the veggies. Thyme salt pepper.garlic cloves. This is amazing. Sent some to my chef son. He loved it.

Best recipe ever! I added a few diced potatoes. I love how the gravy isn't too runny so each bite held together nicely! I used a crust cover to keep the crust from burning and took it off the pie about 3/4 into cooking time. It was perfection!

This is a great starting recipe for chicken pot pie. I added more seasoning to the gravy and potato to the filling. I do think it’s very important to mix the gravy and the veggies/meat combo together before pouring into the pan so everything is evenly combined, rather than just pouring the gravy over top. Might negate a lot of the dry pie issues that people have complained about.
The flavor of this recipe was fantastic. My only issue was that it was a bit too dry. I will continue to make this but will add more liquid.
This is amazing my nephew could not get enough of it. Had to make him his own before I when back home. I added a little poutler spice to the sauce and it was great 👍 👌
Very easy, quick and delicious!

I tripled the recipe and gave one to each adult child (one works two jobs and one coming home from business trip). I should have increased the milk and broth, but that was my bad. The pies were delish! Great recipe!

I was dying to make a pot pie like forever. This was very easy to prepare. I added more liquid ingredients. Next time, for additional flavor I will add 1 table of chopped roasted red peppers from jar and some finely chopped parsley. If you have any leftover, be prepared with some extra some gravy on the side as it became dry as the liquid got absorbed overnight, It was so delishish!!!

This was definitely a hit in my house. But there were a few things I did differently. I substituted the milk for non dairy heavy cream due to me having a dairy allergy. I also boiled my chicken in chicken stock, instead of water, with the celery, onion and frozen peas and carrots and i seasoned it with seasoning salt, pepper, Italian seasoning and onion powder and garlic powder. Other than that I’m definitely recommending this recipe to anyone interested in making this family staple meal.
Great with one crust or two! Love this recipe! Classic comfort food!
I don't normally like pot pie but this was very good. I made it with homemade pie crust.
When I make chicken pot pie I use cream of chicken soup instead of milk and flour. Bumps the taste up double.
Excellent recipe. I add a little sage to the sauce, chopped mushrooms and semi-cooked cubed potatoes. Also, instead of a top crust, I decided to try Pillsbury Grands. Delicious!!

Blandest pot pie I have ever tasted. This recipe had a great concept, but it’s missing the seasonings and the flavor. Then, it was also dry. If I could do it over again, I would not drain the water off of the vegetables and I would cook my meat and vegetables in the chicken broth to give it a more complex flavor. I didn’t really get a chance to read the helpful suggestions until after I had already bought the ingredients and started the pot pie, but as Is the recipe is just a base. The real flavor comes with what you add into it
My favorite chicken pot pie recipe. I don’t change a thing. This is also the first thing I ever cooked for my husband!

I FOLLOWED THE DIRECTIONS AS LISTED ONLY THING I DID WAS BOILED MY CHICKEN IN BROTH AND PUT 1/4TEASPOON OF THYME AND POULTRY SEASONING AND I PUT A THIN LAYER OF PLAIN BREADCRUMBS IN THE BOTTOM PIE SHELL AND THIS RECIPE WAS GREAT! MY HUSBAND ATE ALMOST THE WHOLE PIE THANK YOU FOR THIS RECIPE THEY NEVER FAIL...
This recipe was shared with me by a co-worker and I must it admit it is one of the best I've ever made! It is full of flavor, just the way a baked pot pie should be!

Awesome recipe! I’ve been using it for years. I add garlic powder and onion powder to the gravy for more flavor. The gravy seems to always cook up thick so I save some of the chicken broth from the cooked chicken. I pour the chicken broth into the gravy to thin it out. I then mix the vegetables and chicken into the gravy mixture before pouring it into the pie crust. It turns out perfect!
Did my chicken, carrots, celery & broth in my Ninja on pressure cook then scooped 1 1/2 cups of cooked broth to add to sauce pan along with seasoning my chicken with roasted garlic spices…amazing

This was the best chicken pot pie I have ever made or tasted. Very easy to make and very flavorful. Since I always buy 2% milk, I adjusted the milk ingredient with 1/3 2% milk and 1/3 heavy cream. I used the Pillsbury crust in the box for my top crust and pinched with the pointer and middle finger knuckles for a beautiful pie crust finish.
Absolutely love it and it stays on the menu.. thank you!

Chicken was previously cooked. I used one package of mixed vegetables, some chopped onion, and a few brocolli flowerettes. No celery. I did not make a separate roux. I mixed flour with some of the hot liquid to temper it, added the milk and mixed until it was all blended. Then added it to the chicken mixture. I made my own pastry and put an egg wash on top. It was enough for more than a 9" pie. I baked it more than 35 minutes at 400 in a glass pie plate.
